and I also find the language used I was just looking at the BBC news headlines the other day it was talking of people remembering the fallen like all this ridiculous language the fallen you know and why don't you what are you talking about? people who died in the war yeah I find that irritating but you know actually I did I do er at the weekend in my French weekend this weekend there was a woman there who has done lots of conflict resolution peace building stuff in war-torn areas of the world

and she wants to set up a social venture now to try and scale some of the stuff and I was talking to her about how can it be that human beings we're quite clever at stuff and we do know things about how to tell peop resolve conflict or resolve dispute and yet we're so busy building fucking phones that we're not doing this stuff and it's just absurd that we're not more further advanced

but she told me an interesting thing which I've never thought about that erm in many many many conflicts in the world you cannot bring the two sides together and that's true you know in arguments in life as well

that's religion's fault rather well yeah for whatever reason erm but you see the principles of most conflict resolutions and the first thing you do is get both sides in the room so if you can't do that then you're kind of buggered before you start she explained and so therefore you have to have ways where you can solve a conflict by only working with one side and that's a lot of the work that she's done in various different regions which is when I used to say to you we you can't argue if you stop arguing back then the other one can't argue it's argue it's the same
